parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: Who, which, what, why. Probably emphatic of tis; an interrogative pronoun, who, which or what.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To throw at in opposition, exchange (words) with, perhaps: I compare. From anti and ballo; to bandy.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: From peri and pateo; to tread all around, i.e. Walk at large; figuratively, to live, deport oneself, follow.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Plural
str2: A prolonged form of a primary stao stah'-o; to stand, used in various applications.
From skuthros and a derivative of optanomai; angry-visaged, i.e. Gloomy or affecting a mournful appearance.
